column6: Preparation Time (How long to prepare ingredients)
column8: Cooking Time (Total cooking time, add more details in the instructions below)
column9: Ingredients
column10: Directions
column11: Any other comments about this dish that Andrew and Amanda need to know when building the cookbook?

column9:
1 lb. pork sausage, 2 T finely chopped onion, 6 T. flour,
1 quart milk, 1/2 t. poultry seasoning, 1/2 t. ground nutmeg, 1/4 t. salt, dash Worcestershire sauce, dash hot pepper sauce, biscuits
column10: Crumble sausage into a large saucepan & cook over medium low heat.  Add onion & cook until transparent. Drain - discarding all but 2 T of the drippings.  Stir in the flour and cook over medium low heat about 6 minutes or until mixture bubbles and turns golden.  Stir in milk. Add seasonings; cook stirring until thickened.  To serve slice biscuits & spoon gravy over halves.

column9: 4 plain bagels, 1/2 c. cream cheese (may use flavored if want to), 8 sharp cheddar cheese slices, 8 eggs, 8 slices fully cooked bacon, cut in half, 2 T chopped fresh chives (optional)
column10: Heat oven to 375.  Cover baking sheet with foil sprayed with cooking spray.  Use a 1 1/2 inch round cookie cutter to cut piece out of the center of each bagel half, discard removed pieces. Spread cut sides of bagel halves with cream cheese and place cheese side down on baking sheet.  Cut 1 1/2 inch "X" into center of each cheese slice. Place on tops of bagels; press centers of cheese slices into holes in bagels.  Crack 1 egg into small bowl; slip into hole in 1 prepared bagel half.  Repeat with remaining eggs and bagel halves.  Top with bacon on sides - leaving egg area open. Bake 14 - 15 minutes or until egg whites are set & yolks are cooked to desired doneness.  Sprinkle with chives.

column9: 1 pkg. lemon cake mix, 1- 3 ounce pkg. vanilla instant pudding mix, 4 eggs, 1 c. hot water, 1/2 c. oil, 1/4 c. poppy seeds
column10: Mix all together for 4 minutes.  Grease 2 loaf pans and bake 350 for 50 minutes

column9: 1 c. chopped nuts, 1 c. chocolate chips,  1/2 c white sugar, 1/2 c brown sugar, 1 t. cinnamon, 1 c. white sugar, 1/2 c. butter, softened, 2 eggs, 1 - 8 ounce carton sour cream, 1 t. vanilla, 2 c. flour, 1 t. baking powder, 1/2 t. baking soda, 1/8 t. salt
column10:
Preheat oven to 350. Grease a 13x9 pan and set aside.  For topping, in a small bowl, combine 1 c. nuts, chips, 1/2 c. white and 1/2 c. brown sugar & cinnamon. Set aside.
In a large bowl combine 1 c. white sugar and the butter, beat with electric mixer on medium speed until fluffy.  Add eggs, beat until combined. Beat in sour cream and vanilla. In another bowl combine the flour, baking powder, soda, and salt.  Add flour mixture to butter mixture, beating until smooth.
Spread 1/2 of the batter into the prepared pan (batter is thick and this is the hardest step of the recipe).  Sprinkle 1/2 of the topping mixture over batter.  Then carefully spread remaining batter over the topping (I find it easier to drop by tablespoons full and then try to spread out as best I can). Sprinkle remaining topping over batter. Bake for 30 minutes, or  until toothpick comes out clean.

This coffee cake is delicious and is worth dealing with the thick batter - it always turns out great!

column9: 1 large hard boiled egg peeled and sliced, 1 2/3 c. chopped asparagus, 2 slices cooked and crumbled bacon, 1/2 t. Dijon mustard, 1 t. olive oil, 1 t. red wine vinegar, pinch of salt & pepper
column10: Bring a pot of water to a boil and add the asparagus and cook for 2 - 3 minutes.  Drain, then rinse under cold water; and set aside. In a small bowl mix mustard, oil, vinegar, salt & pepper. Arrange the asparagus on a plate, top with the egg and bacon.  Then drizzle vinaigrette over the top. Make a double batch of dressing if you like more dressing on your salad.

column2: Olive Garden Copycat Zuppa Toscana Soup
column9: 1 lb. Italian sausage, 2 large russet baking potatoes, sliced in half and then in 1/4 inch slices, 1 large onion, 1/4 c. bacon bits, 2 cloves of garlic, minced, 2 c. kale or swiss chard, chopped, 2 - 8 ounce cans of chicken broth, 1 quart water, 1 c. heavy cream
column10: Chop or slice uncooked sausage into small pieces and brown in a soup pot. Add chicken broth and water to pot. Place onions, potatoes and garlic in pot. Cook on medium heat until potatoes are done. Add bacon. Salt & pepper to taste.  Simmer for another 10 minutes. Turn heat to low and add kale/swiss chard & cream.  Heat through - then serve.
column11: If you don't have heavy cream just make a mixture of 1/4 c. melted butter with 3/4 c. milk and mix thoroughly-for a substitute.

column9: 4 c. packed basil leaves (about 2 1/2 ounces), 4 cloves of garlic ( I use 6 or more), 1/4 c. pine nuts, 1/2 c. grated parmesan cheese, 3/4 t. salt, 1/2 t. pepper, 6 T. olive oil
column10: In a food processor, chop basil, garlic, pine nuts, parmesan, salt & pepper for 10 seconds. Combine olive oil and 1/2 c. warm water in a small bowl. With processor on, slowly pour in oil mixture, processing just until blended. Serve right away or store with plastic wrap against surface of pesto in an airtight container in the refrigerator or freezer.
column11: Store up to 2 weeks in the refrigerator or 3 months in the freezer. If the top turns brown, I just take off that layer and toss it and use the bright green layer underneath it.

column9: 3 c. chopped tomatoes, 1/2 c. chopped green bell pepper, 1 c. diced onion, 1/4 c. fresh minced cilantro, 2 T. lime juice, 4 t. fresh chopped jalapeno pepper, 1/2 t. ground cumin,       1 t. sea salt, 1 t. black pepper, 1 1/2 t. minced garlic (I use more)
column10: Mix all together and refrigerate

column9: 1 c. pimiento stuffed green olives, chopped, 2 T. olive oil, 2 T. red wine vinegar, 1 clove garlic finely chopped, 1/2 t. dried oregano, 1 T. capers, chopped (optional), black pepper, 1 8-inch diameter round bread loaf, 4 ounces capicola ham, 4 ounces genoa salami, 2 ounces sliced provolone cheese
column10: In a medium bowl combine the olives, oil, vinegar, garlic, oregano, capers and 1/4 t. pepper. Split the bread in half and scoop out the the inside of both top & bottom, leaving a 3/4' shell. Spread the olive mixture on the cut sides of the bread and form a large sandwich with the ham, salami and provolone.  Wrap the sandwich in plastic wrap and place on a large plate or baking sheet. Place a second plate or baking sheet on top & put heavy cans on the plate to weight it down. Refrigerate for 6 hours or up to overnight.  Cut into wedges before serving.

column9: 1 lb fingerling potatoes, cut crosswise into 1-inch pieces; 2 cups fresh snap peas; 2 cups chopped skinless, boneless rotisserie chicken breast; 1/2 cup finely chopped red bell pepper; 1/2 cup finely chopped red onion; 2 tbsp extra-virgin oil; 2 tbsp white wine vinegar; 1 tbsp fresh lemon juice; 1 tbsp Dijon mustard; 1 tsp minced fresh tarragon; 1 tsp salt; 1/2 tsp freshly ground black pepper; 1 garlic glove minced.
column10: Step 1: Place potatoes in a large saucepan; cover with cold water.  Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer 10 mins or until almost tender. Add peas, cook 2 mins or until peas are crisp-tender. Drain, place vegetables in a large bowl.  Add chicken, bell pepper and onion. Step 2: Combine oil and remaining ingredients, stirring with a whisk.  Drizzle over salad, toss gently to combine.
column11: Serve warm at room temperature or chilled for maximum versatility.  Leftovers make and easy and satisfying lunch.  While it's called a salad, I made a meal out of it!

column8: 45 minutes (or so depending on duck doneness you like)
column9: 1/2 cup soy sauce, 1/4 cup water, 2 T. minced onion (or onion powder), 1 t. red pepper flakes, 2 T. sesame seeds, 1 T. sugar, 1 - 3 T. minced garlic, 8 duck breast filets (or cut up pieces for duck appetizers),  8 slices of bacon
column10:
Mix above ingredients and add duck, marinade overnight: tipping upside down every so often, or stirring to move pieces around.  Take out duck pieces and wrap  bacon around them. Place on sprayed baking rack inside a pan and bake 45 minutes at 350/375 degrees or until desired doneness.

If making duck appetizers, put duck piece on a tooth pick, add a pineapple chunk and top with green, red, yellow or hot pepper. Bake on sprayed rack on a 9x13 or larger pan for 30 - 45 minutes depending on doneness of bacon.
column11: Line baking pans with foil, otherwise cleanup is not fun!

column9: 35 saltine crackers (sleeve) 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup brown sugar, 1 package chocolate chips (8oz.), 1 cup nuts (I usually use slivered almonds-but whatever you have/like)
column10:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. Place crackers in a single layer on a foil-lines 15x10x1 inch baking pan.  

Heat butter and sugar in a saucepan on medium-high heat until butter is melted and mixture is well blended.  Bring to boil and boil 3 minutes without stirring. spread over crackers.

Bake 5 minutes. Take out of oven and immediately sprinkle with chocolate chips; let stand 5 minutes. Then spread melted chocolate evenly over ingredients in pan.  Sprinkle with nuts.  Cool - put in fridge if needed.  Cut or break into pieces.
column11: Super good, and easy!

column9:
1 package devils food cake mix, 1 package 3.9 oz. instant chocolate pudding mix
3 cups shredded zucchini, 1 container ready to spread chocolate frosting, 1 cup cool whip.
column10: Prepare cake batter as directed on package. Add dry pudding mix and beat 2 minutes. Add zucchini, beat just till blended. Pour into 2 greased 9 inch round cake pans and bake 28 - 30 minutes.  Cool completely.  Spoon frosting into a medium bowl. Add cool whip and mix till blended.  Frost; putting a layer between cakes also.
column11: Easy!

column9: 1-2 pounds of shrimp, 2 T. olive oil, 1 T. garlic, 1/2 t. red pepper flakes, 1/4 cup white wine, 1/4 cup butter cut up, 2 T. parsley, 2 green onions.  Spaghetti for 4.
column10:
Cook spaghetti while making sauce. 

Heat oil over medium heat & add shrimp, remove when done. Add garlic & cook 30 seconds, then add red pepper flakes, & white wine.  Reduce to 1 T. then add butter 1 T at a time until melted.  Remove from heat and add parsley, green onions and shrimp. Mix sauce with cooked spaghetti.

column9:
Cake:
1 package yellow cake mix, 1 package 4 serving instant vanilla pudding mix, 1 1/3 cup water
4 eggs, 1/4 cup oil, 2 cups coconut, 1 cup chopped nuts (optional)

Frosting:
4 T. butter, 2 cups coconut, 1 8-oz package cream cheese (at room temp) , 2 t. milk, 3 1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 t. vanilla
column10:
Cake:
Blend cake mix, pudding mix, water, eggs and oil in a large mixer. Beat at medium speed for 4 minutes. Stir in coconut and nuts. Pour into 3 greased 9" layer pan.  Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Remove and cool completely. Fill middle of layers and cake with cocnut frosting.

Frosting:
Melt 2 T of butter in a skillet. Add coconut and stir constantly over low heat until golden brown. Spread on paper towel to cool. Cream 2 T butter with cream cheese. Add milk and sugar alternately, beating well.  Add vanilla, stir in 1 3/4 cup coconut. Spread on layers and rest of cake. Sprinkle cake with rest of coconut.
column11: Annually requested cake by mom!

column9: salt, 1 pound asparagus cut into 1" pieces, 3 T vegetable oil, 3 large eggs lightly beaten, 5 Oz. thick sliced ham cut into 1/4" pieces, 2 cloves of garlic, 4 Cups cooked and cooled white rice, 3 T soy sauce, 5 scallions/green onions
column10:
Bring medium saucepan of salted water to a boil. Add asparagus & cook until tender about 2 minutes.
Warm 1 T oil in a large skilled over medium-high heat. Add eggs and cook without stirring until set around the edges, about 30 seconds. Break eggs into pieces with spatula & stir until fully cooked and set, about 1 minute longer. Scrape into a bowl.
Add remaining 2 T oil to skillet and add ham & garlic, stirring until garlic is fragrant. Add rice and soy sauce and cook stirring until rice is coated and very hot, about 3-4 minutes. Stir in asparagus, eggs, scallions and cook another minute.
column11: Cook thick asparagus longer, depends on the season the size of the asparagus!

column9: 2 T. butter, 1 onion chopped, 2 stalks celery, 3 carrots chopped, 6 T. flour, 4 cups chicken/beef broth (depending on meat used), 2 potatoes peeled and diced, 2 cups shredded meat of your choice, 2 T. parsley, 1/2 cup frozen peas (optional), 1 prepared pie crust, 1 egg slightly beaten
column10:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees.

Melt butter in saucepan and cook chopped onion until tender. Stir in celery and carrots and cook for 2 minutes.  Stir in flour (with veggies) and cook for 2 minutes. Add stock and bring to a simmer. Add potatoes and simmer until tender. Stir in meat, parsley, and peas. Pour mixture into pie  casserole dish. Top with pie crust and brush with egg. Bake for 30 minutes until crust is golden brown.
column11: Duck pot pie is delicious too!

column9: 10 oz. cream cheese, 1/2 c chopped artichoke hearts, 1/2 c chopped spinach, 1 1/4 c mozzarella, 1 c parmesan, 1 clove of garlic, 1/2 t red pepper flakes, salt and pepper to taste, 2 T melted butter, 1 t parsley, 1/2 t garlic powder, 1 can crescent sheet dough
column10: Preheat oven to 350 and line a small cooking sheet with parchment paper. In a large bowl combine cream cheese, artichoke hearts, spinach, mozzarella, parmesan, garlic clove, and red pepper flakes. Season with salt and pepper. Form into one large ball. Roll crescent dough out on prepared baking sheet and place cheese ball in center. Wrap dough around cheese ball and seal. Flip over so the clean side is up. Combine melted butter with parsley and garlic powder. Brush all over ball and bake until golden, about 25 minutes. Serve and enjoy!
column11: Once instead of baking in the oven we smoked the ball and it was delish!

column9: 4 slices of bacon, For The Chicken: 1 T vegetable oil, 1 T butter, 4 boneless-skinless chicken breasts, salt and pepper to taste, 1/2 t garlic powder, 1/2 t paprika, For The Ranch Cream Cheese: 4 oz. cream cheese, 1/4 t garlic powder, 1/4 t onion powder, 1/4 t dried dill weed, 1/2 t dried chives, 4 oz. shredded cheddar cheese, For Garnish, fresh parsley, green onions
column10: Preheat oven to 400. Grease a 9x13 pan and set aside. Set a large skillet over medium heat and add in bacon-cook until crisp. Remove bacon from skillet but do not discard bacon fat. Return skillet to heat and add in oil. Pound the chicken breasts into 1/4 inch thickness and season with salt, pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. Add chicken to skillet and cook for 2-3 minutes or until golden brown. Flip over the chicken and continue to cook for 3 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet and arrange in baking dish, set aside. In a bowl combine cream cheese, garlic powder, onion powder, dill weed and chives. (You can also stir in 1 T of store bought ranch seasoning instead). Top each chicken breast with the cream cheese mixture. Spread to coat the surface of each one. Take half of the bacon and add on top. Sprinkle with cheddar cheese. Bake uncovered for 15 minutes or until chicken in cooked through. Remove from oven and garnish with remaining bacon, parsley, and onions. Serve!

column9: 3 1/2 c flour, 3 c sugar, 4 eggs, 2 t baking soda, 1 1/2 t salt, 2 t ground allspice, 1 t baking powder, 1 t ground nutmeg, 1 t cinnamon, 1/2 t ground cloves, 15 oz canned pumpkin puree, 3/4 c vegetable oil, 2/3 c water.
column10: Preheat oven to 350. In a large bowl combine the dry ingredients. In another bowl, whisk the eggs, pumpkin, oil, and water. Stir into dry ingredients. Pour into 2-3 greased loaf pans. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the middle comes out clean. Enjoy!

column9: 1 large head of cauliflower (cut into small florets), 2 T unsalted butter, salt and pepper to taste, 2/3 c sour cream, 1/4 c heavy cream, 2 cloves of garlic, 1 1/2 c cheddar cheese, 6 T bacon (cooked and chopped), 1/4 c green onions.
column10: Preheat oven to 450. In a large bowl toss the cauliflower florets with butter. Season with salt and pepper. Roast the cauliflower on a greased sheet pan for 15-20 minutes. Meanwhile, in another bowl whisk together the sour cream and heavy cream. Stir in the garlic, half of the cheddar cheese, half of the bacon, and half of the green onions. When the cauliflower is done, add it to the mixture. Pour cauliflower mixture into a greased baking dish and top with remaining cheese and bacon. Bake for 5-10 minutes. Top with remaining green onions. Serve.

column9: 2 lbs ground chicken, 1 egg, 1/2 c plain bread crumbs, 1 oz ranch seasoning mix, 3 garlic cloves, 1/2 c diced onions, 1/3 c shredded cheddar cheese
column10: Combine all ingredients in a mixing bowl. Shape the burger patties. Preheat a large skillet over medium heat and add oil. Cook burgers for 6-8 minutes on each side. Assemble with your favorite burger toppings and enjoy!

column2: Brussel Sprout, Bacon, and Blue Cheese Bites
column9: Brussel sprouts, blue cheese (block works better than crumbles), bacon (uncooked), oil, salt and pepper
column10: Trim the ends of the brussel sprouts and cut them in half. Toss with some oil and salt and pepper. Place face down on a parchment lined baking sheet. Roast for 12-15 minutes until mostly cooked through. While the brussel sprouts are roasting, cut the bacon into little pieces (about 2 inches wide). Cut the blue cheese block into small pieces (so they fit on top of the brussel sprout). When the brussel sprouts are done, flip them over so the cut side is face up. Next, top with a little cheese, and a piece of bacon and spear a toothpick through it. Pop them back in the oven and roast for another 10-12 minutes until bacon is nice and crispy. Try to make sure the brussel sprouts are standing up when cooking!
column11: You can substitute the blue cheese for any other kind of cheese. Such as goat, feta or even brie.

column9: 2 c balsamic vinegar, 10 oz cherry tomatoes, 8 oz mozzarella pearls, fresh basil leaves, salt and pepper, toothpicks
column10: Add the balsamic vinegar to a small saucepan over high heat then bring to a boil. Turn the heat down to medium then simmer until vinegar is the consistency of thin maple syrup, 20 minutes. While that is cooking, cut the tomatoes in half. You may want to cut the basil leaves into smaller pieces as well. When the vinegar is ready, pour into a small bowl and set aside. Spear a toothpick into a tomato, make sure the cut side is face down so that the skewer can stand up. Then follow with a basil leaf then a mozzarella ball. Place onto a serving platter. Repeat with remaining ingredients. Just before serving, sprinkle the skewers with salt and pepper then drizzle with the cooled balsamic vinegar.
column11: You can also buy store bought balsamic vinegar reduction to same time.

column9: 2 c of dark chocolate chips, 3 T butter, 2/3 c heavy cream, 3 T of Baileys Irish Cream, Chocolate hail or cocoa or sprinkles for coating
column10: Place the chocolate chips into a large bowl that could fit into the fridge. Place butter and cream in a small saucepan and place over low to medium heat. Stir while the butter melts and continue heating until it reaches a simmer. Remove from heat and pour over the chocolate chips. Let it stand for a minute or two then whisk until all the chocolate is melted and its smooth. Add the Baileys Irish Cream and mix well (You can add more Baileys to your taste). Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and cool in the fridge for about 2-3 hours. It will be firm but not hard when ready. Working quickly, use a spoon and form the chocolate mixture into balls (size is up to you). Roll into coating and set aside on a serving platter or in a container. Store the truffles in the freezer or fridge until ready to serve. Enjoy-but not too many!
column11: If you want to chocolate dip your truffles, cool the formed balls before dipping. Then cool again until ready to serve.

column9: 2 pkg pudding mix (vanilla), 3 c milk, 1 c powdered sugar, 8 oz cream cheese, 1/4 c butter (softened), 12 oz of cool whip, 14 oz pkg of oreos (crushed)
column10: In a bowl, whisk together pudding mix and milk. In another bowl, cream together sugar, cream cheese, and butter. Add to other mixture. Then add in cool whip. Layer in a 9x13 pan: 1/2 oreo crumbs, pudding mixture, 1/2 oreo crumbs. Keep in fridge! Enjoy!
column11: You can add gummy worms to this dessert if desired!

column9: 4 T flour, 2 T brown sugar, 1/4 t baking powder, 3 T milk, 1/8 t vanilla, 1/2 T vegetable oil, 2 T chocolate chips
column10: Mix everything but the chocolate chips in a microwavable mug. Mix half of the chocolate chips into the batter and sprinkle the rest on top. Microwave for about 1 minute.

column9: 1 box of Mac & Cheese (need milk and butter for this), 2 eggs (slightly beaten), 1 jar of pizza sauce, 1lb hamburger, 8 oz pkg of mozzarella, pepperoni (optional)
column10: Follow the directions on the box to prepare the Mac & Cheese. While that is cooking, brown the hamburger in a pan and set aside. When the Mac & Cheese is done, add slightly beaten eggs. Spread the Mac & Cheese mixture in a greased 9x13 pan and cook for 10 minutes. When done, spread the rest of the ingredients on top in the following layers: sauce, hamburger, cheese, pepperoni. Then bake 10 more minutes!

column9: 24-30 frozen meatballs, 1 can cream of chicken soup, 2 c frozen veggies, 3 c tator tots, 1 1/2 c shredded cheddar cheese
column10: Pour frozen meatballs, soup, and veggies into slow cooker and mix. Top with tator tots. Cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 5 hours. Remove lid and sprinkle cheese on top, and cook until cheese is melted!

column9: 2.5 cups flour, 1 tsp baking soda, 1 tsp salt, 1 cup butter (can use 1/2 margarine & 1/2 butter flavored crisco), 3/4 cup white sugar, 3/4 cup brown sugar, 1 tsp vanilla, 1/3 box vanilla pudding, 2 eggs, 3/4 cup semi-sweet chocolate chips, 1/4 cup milk chocolate chips, 1/4 cup butterscotch chips
column10: In the first bowl, mix together flour, baking soda, and salt. In bowl 2 (bigger bowl) mix butter, white sugar, brown sugar, vanilla, and vanilla putting. Add contents of bowl 1 into bowl 2 and mix. Then add eggs and mix. Then in bowl 1, mix semi-sweet chocolate chips, milk chocolate chips, and butterscotch chips. Then mix bowl 1 into bowl 2. Preheat oven to 365 degrees. Using a cookie scoop & dark pans, bake for 13 min. Then let cool on cooling rack.

column9: 3 cups of flower, 1 tsp baking soda, 1/2 tsp salt, 1 stick (1/2 cup) butter (room temp), 1/2 cup shortening (crisco stick), 1 cup sugar, 1/2 cup packed brown sugar, 2 eggs, 2 tbsp water, 1 tsp vanilla extract, 1 (9oz) pkg Andes Mints, 56 walnut halves (optional)
column10: Sift together flour, baking soda and salt; set aside. Beat together butter and shortening in a bowl with an electric mixer on medium high until fluffy. Add sugars; beat thoroughly. Add eggs, water and vanilla extract, beating until well blended. Add flour mixture, beating just until combined. Cover bowl; refrigerate at least 2 hours. Heat oven to 375 degrees. For each cookie, use 1 tbsp of dough and form in around 1 chocolate mint. Place cookies on baking sheet about 2'' apart. Top with walnut half (opt). Bake until golden brown, about 10-12 min. Remove and let cool on cooling rack.
column11: Fanny May mint chocolates are better than andes, can also substitute with a Hershey kiss for people that done like mint and chocolate. These cookies got 2nd place in the first ever Pillsburry Bake off in 1949, it was my Nana's god mothers and cousins recipe.

column8: 10 minutes depending on how many need to be done
column9: Duck; marinated, cooked & shredded,  bean sprouts, shredded cabbage, diced green onions, diced green peppers/jalapeno peppers, bamboo shoots or whatever you like in your egg rolls, and egg roll wrappers
column10:
Shred duck and combine with all other egg rolls stuffing you like in a large bowl.  Put 1-3 T. of filling in the middle of the wrapper (don't over stuff).  Wet entire edge of egg roll wrapper with water, using your finger.  With wrapper in front of you like a triangle, fold bottom wrapper up and over filling. Then fold in both sides and then roll up like a log. Directions for wrapping are also on egg rolls package.

You may fry the egg rolls in oil, bake in the oven or cook in an air fryer Cook until wrapper is browned.
column11:
I like them best fried; but seal WELL or oil gets inside and then they are not very good!
I use Sesame Duck recipe marinade for the duck, or goose used in the recipe.

column9: 1 - 4 pound chicken cut into 10 pieces, 3 T. Emeril's Essence or creole seasoning, 2 T. vegetable oil, 1/2 pound smoked andouille or spicy sausage sliced 1/4" thick, 2 C. diced yellow onion, 1 cup EACH green & red pepper and celery, 1 t. salt, 1/4 t EACH cayenne and black pepper, 1 - 2 T. chopped garlic, 3 bay leaves, 1 t. minced thyme, 2 cups (not instant) rice, 4 cups chicken broth, 1 pound medium raw shrimp, 1 cup chopped scallions, 1/2 cup minced parsley
column10:
Season chicken with 2 T. essence.  In an 8 quart pot, heat oil and brown chicken in batches about 10 minutes. Drain on paper towel.

Add sausage to drippings in pot and cook about 3 minutes; stirring until well browned. Add onions, peppers, celery, salt, cayenne and black pepper, cooking and stirring often, about 5 minutes or until veggies are softened. Add garlic, bay leaves, and thyme, cook about 2 minutes. Add rice, cook stirring about 2 minutes.

Add broth, bring to a boil.  Place chicken pieces on top and reduce heat, cover and simmer until rice is tender, about 14 minutes.

 Season shrimp with remaining 1 T. of seasoning. Add to rice, cover and cook until shrimp are pink; about 3 minutes.  Remove pot from heat and let stand covered 5 minutes.  Add scallions, parsley and gently stir.  Remove bay leaves.
column11: You can make your own or buy Emeril Seasoning.

column9: 1 c. margarine softened, 1 1/2 cups sugar, 2 eggs, 3 T sour milk (make by adding 1/2 t. vinegar to milk), 1 t. baking soda, 1 t. vanilla, 3 - 4 cups flour (may need more)
column10: Mix all together and pour into 11x7 pans (not sure how many pans it makes). Bake 350 degrees for 10 - 12 minutes.  Freezes well

column9: 1 pound powdered sugar, 1 large egg white, 1/2 cup butter, 1/2 cup Crisco, 1 t. vanilla, 1/4 t. salt
column10: Mix all ingredients together until blended then whip on high until fluffy
column11: Lasts forever in the fridge!

column9: 1 cup margarine, 1 1/2 cup sugar, 2 eggs, 1 cup Crisco, 3 T. sour milk (mix 1/2 t. vinegar into milk), 1 t. baking soda, 1 t. vanilla, 3 -4 cups flour (add until dough not sticky)
column10: Mix margarine, shortening, sugar and eggs, vanilla and milk.  Mix flour & soda & then add to wet mixture, until not sticky.  Chill dough, it makes it easier to roll out.  Sprinkle small amount of flour on surface then add dough & roll to desired thickness. Cut out cookies, then bake 350 degrees until brown edges appear (or not).
column11: Grandma loved these cookie super thin!

column9: 2 eggs slightly beaten, 1 small can of pumpkin, 1 cup brown sugar, 1/2 t. salt, 1/2 t. cinnamon (may add more), 1/2 t. ginger, 1 2/3 cup evaporated milk (size of 1 can), 1 pie shell (not cooked)
column10: Mix all ingredients together and pour into an unbaked 9" pie shell. Bake at 425 degrees for 15 minutes, then reduce oven to 375 and bake an additional 45 minutes or until a knife inserted in center comes out clean.

column9: Potatoes peeled & cut into small pieces, 3 small onions cut into small pieces, 1 t. salt, 1 1/4 cup milk, 3 T. butter, 1/3 cup potato flakes.
column10: Cook potatoes and onions and salt in pot with just enough water to cover. Bring to a boil and cook until potatoes are tender. Turn heat down to medium and add milk, butter and salt & pepper to taste. Cook until butter is melted and then add potato flakes; may add more if want soup thicker.
column11: We think grandma used about 2 large potatoes?

column9: 3 chicken bouillon cubes, 2 cups water, onion (as much as wanted), 4 cups broccoli (or 1 bag of frozen), 4 cups milk, 1/2 - 4/4 cup flour, 1/2 cup butter softened, 2 cups Velveeta cheese (cut into cubes), may add salt but taste first!
column10: Dissolve bouillon cubes in water, then cook broccoli in this broth until tender. Add milk, cream together flour & butter to make a smooth rouge. Gradually add this mixture to soup mixture & stir. Turn down heat and simmer about 15 minutes. Add cheese and heat until it melts. Stir often to prevent sticking.
column11: Easy recipe!!!

column9: 2 cups flour, 1 T. ginger, 1 t. cinnamon, 1/2 t. salt, 3/4 cup shortening, 1 cup sugar, 1 egg, 1/4 cup molasses or sorghum. More sugar for rolling in later.
column10: Cream sugar & shortening. Add egg & molasses. Add dry ingredients and blend. Form into balls & roll in sugar (more). Bake 350 degrees for about 12 minutes

column9: 1 1/2 cups chicken broth, 3 T. flour (I use more to make it thicker 2 T.), 3 T. butter, 1 cup milk, 1 package mushrooms sliced, salt & pepper to taste
column10: Sautee mushrooms in butter in pot, then remove from pan. Add flour & cook for 2 - 3 minutes. Add broth & milk slowly to pot while stirring.  Cook until thick, then return mushrooms to pan, simmer.  Add salt & pepper to taste.

column9:
To make the dough: 

1 quart warm milk, 1 package of active yeast, 1/3 cup warm water, 1 T. salt, 1 cup Crisco-melted, 1 cup sugar, 10-12 cups flour
column10:
To make dough: 

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Add yeast to the warm water and let sit. Using an electric mixer put sugar, salt, Crisco, milk, and yeast mixture into the bowl. Add in 4 cups of flour to start with. Mix on low speed. Keep adding more flour as it continues to mix (up to the 10-12 cups needed).  When done, the dough should not be sticky. Leave the dough in the bowl and pat down so it is level inside. Then grease the top of the dough and sides of the bowl with Crisco. Turn the oven off. Put a towel over the top of the bowl and put in the oven to let rise until doubled in size. (About 2 hours).

To make coffee cake:

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Grease 11x7 pans (about 4-5) with Crisco. Melt 4 sticks of butter. Take the dough out of the oven and punch the middle to let the dough fall down. Take out a softball sized handful of dough (more dough=thicker coffee cake). Roll out on a floured surface until it is able to fit into the pan. Spread the melted butter over the top of the dough (about ¼ c butter for each pan). Then sprinkle the *cinnamon and sugar mixture on top (however much you want-we like a lot). Turn the oven off. Put pans in the oven to let rise to double in size-may need to pile on top of each other to get them all to fit in the oven.
* 2 cups of sugar mixed with 1 teaspoon of cinnamon


To make rolls:

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Then scoop about ¼ c of the melted butter into the bottom of each round pan (4-5 pans). Sprinkle ¼ to 1/3 c of brown sugar into each pan on top of the butter. More sugar=more caramel. Then take a softball sized handful of dough and roll it out into a thin rectangle on a floured surface. Put a layer of melted butter on the rolled out dough. Then sprinkle the cinnamon and sugar mixture on top. Then roll the dough up like a log. Cut the log into 1 inch rolls and put the rolls into the pan about ¼ to ½ inch apart. Turn the oven off. Put pans in the oven to let rise to double in size-may need to pile on top of each other to get them all to fit in the oven.

To bake:

Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Rolls and coffee cake should bake for about 10-12 minutes. Usually do 5-6 minutes and then switch the pans from top to bottom in the oven. When they are done, you should be able to shake the pan and they should be a little loose.
column11: *When Abby & I made this recipe we got 3 rolls and 5 coffee cakes, but ours were a little thick!

column9:
4 Cups all-purpose flour
3 Cups sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1-1/2 teaspoons salt
1 teaspoon baking soda
4 large eggs, room temperature
1-1/2 cups canola oil
1 teaspoon each coconut, rum and vanilla extracts
3 cups shredded zucchini
1 cup canned crushed pineapple, drained
1/2 cup chopped walnuts or chopped pecans
column10:
1. Line the bottoms of 3 greased and floured 8x4-in. loaf pans with waxed paper and grease the paper; set pans aside. Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and baking soda. In another bowl, whisk the eggs, oil and extracts. Stir into dry ingredients until just moistened. Fold in the zucchini, pineapple and walnuts.
3. Transfer to prepared pans. Bake for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks. Gently remove waxed paper.

column9:
2 bags oyster crackers
1 cup vegetable oil
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon dill weed
1/2 teaspoon lemon pepper
1 package hidden valley dressing (dry)
column10: Mix oil and spices and pour over oyster crackers; mix.
column11: Best served with Busch Latte

column9:
1 lb. hamburger
1 can red kidney beans
1 can tomato soup
1 container frozen tomatoes or canned ones
onion
chili powder, salt and pepper
column10: Brown hamburger and onion (salt some). I do mine in mic (Grandma). Add all ingredients and simmer.
column11: Grandma was rather vague with her ingredients and instructions. You may have to play around with this one a little, but it's a good one! Good luck!

column9:
1 tortilla
2 eggs
shredded cheddar cheese
pre-cooked meat of your choice (sausage, bacon, ham, etc.)
salt and pepper to taste
butter or cooking spray
column10: Pick frying pan close to the size of your tortillas. Beat eggs and season with salt and pepper. Heat pan on medium heat and melt butter. Add eggs to pan lightly swirl eggs around pan to allow eggs to evenly cook. While the center of the egg is still wet add some shredded cheese and lay the tortilla on top of the eggs and cheese. Gently remove eggs from the edges of the pan. Once the entire egg has released from the pan and egg edges are set, flip the egg and tortilla so the tortilla lays down on the pan-side. Add more cheese and optional breakfast meat of your choice on top of half of the eggs. Fold over tortilla and continue cooking on both sides until golden brown and cheese has melted.

column9:
1 & 3/4 Cup all- purpose flour
1 teaspoon sugar
1 & 1/2 Sticks butter (12 tablespoons) cut into slices
1/4 cup + 2 Tbsp ice water (approximately)
column10: Place flour and sugar into food processor. Pulse until combined. Add half of the butter and pulse. Add the rest of the butter, pulse until the mixture turns into coarse crumbs. Through the feed tube on the food processor, slowly add the ice water and pulse until the dough gathers into a ball. If it doesn't combine into a ball after a few seconds add a few more drops of ice water sparingly until it does. Flatten dough into a disc and place on a sheet of floured plastic wrap. Refrigerate for about 30 mins before rolling.
column11: To help prevent pie crust from sticking to rolling pin, roll dough between two sheets of plastic wrap.

column9:
1 cup sugar
1 cup firmly packed brown sugar
1 cup margarine
2 eggs
1 1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
3-4 cups flour
12 oz. chocolate chips
column10: Place sugar, brown sugar, margarine, eggs, and vanilla in bowl. Mix about 80 seconds. Gradually add flour, salt, and baking soda to mixture. Add chocolate chips last. Drop by teaspoon onto a greased cookie sheet. Bake at 375 degrees for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from sheet immediately.

column9:
10 oz Spring mix
2 Gala apples, cored and chopped
1 cup candied pecans
5 oz goat cheese, crumbled
Balsamic Vinaigrette
column10: Place spring mix in large bowl. Add chopped apples, pecans, and goat cheese over spring mix. Dress spring mix immediately before serving.

column9:
50 ct Totino's Pizza Rolls of your choice
5 oz Pepperoni Minis
Shredded Mozzarella cheese
Pizza Sauce (optional)
Toppings (Be creative!)
column10: Preheat oven to 425 degrees and line baking sheet with nonstick paper. Spread single layer of pizza rolls onto baking sheet. Bake for 10-12 mins. Concentrate pizza rolls toward the center on the pan. Drizzle with pizza sauce (optional). Sprinkle cheese and toppings over all pizza rolls. Bake for additional 2-5 mins or until cheese is melted.

column9: 4 large boneless chicken halves or 8 small; 1/2 tsp salt; 1/4 to 1/2 tsp black pepper; 2 Tbsp olive or salad oil; 2 Tbsp butter or margarine; 3 Tbsp chopped fresh chives or green onions; Juice of 1/2 lime or lemon; 2 Tbsp brandy or cognac (optional-not for me); 3 Tbsp chopped parsley; 2 tsp Dijon-style mustard; 1/4 cup chicken broth.
column10: 1) Place chicken breast halves between sheets of waxed paper or plastic wrap, Pound slightly with a mallet. Sprinkle with salt and black pepper. 2) Heat 1 Tbsp each of oil and butter in large skillet. 3) Cook chicken over high heat for 4 minutes on each side.  Do not cook longer or they will be over-cooked and dry.  Transfer to warm serving platter. 4) Add chives or green onion, lime juice and brandy (if used), parsley and mustard to pan.  Cook 15 seconds, whisking constantly. 5) Whisk in broth. Serve until sauce is smooth. Whisk in remaining butter and oil. 6) Pour sauce over chicken.  Serve immediately.
column11: Good served with: Noodles with tomato sauce, steamed broccoli and fresh salad.

column9: 1/4 cup finely chopped unsalted roasted pistachios; 1 Tbsp toasted sesame seeds; pinch of crushed red pepper flakes; a pinch of kosher salt; few grinds of black pepper; 5.2-oz. package Boursin cheese.
column10: Mix pistachios, sesame seeds, red pepper flakes, salt & black pepper on a plate or in a shallow bowl to combine.  Pat the cheese into a ball and roll in pistachio mixture to coat.
column11: Serve with crostini or crackers.

column9: Fireball whiskey; RumChata Cream Liqueur
column10: Mix equal parts of the whiskey & cream liqueur.
column11: Can serve as shots or on ice as an after-dinner drink!

column9:
6 Pork chops, cut 1/2 inch thick
2 Tbsp Cooking oil
Salt
Pepper
3 Tbsp butter or margarine 
3 Tbsp flour
1 1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp pepper
2 tsp instant chicken bouillon or 2 chicken bouillon cubes
2 cups water
6 cups slices pared potatoes
1 medium onion, slices and separated into rings
column10:
Brown pork chops on both sides in hot oil in 12 inch skillet. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste.
Meanwhile, melt butter in saucepan. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, chicken bouillon and water. Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil.
Place potatoes in bottom of 8x12 inch baking dish. Top with onion rings. Pour chicken broth mixture evenly over top. Top with pork chops. Cover with foil.
Bake in preheated 350 degree oven for 1 hour. Remove foil and continue baking 30 minutes or until meat is tender.

Microwave
In step 2, microwave butter on high 20-30 seconds in 2 quart glass measure. Stir in flour, salt, pepper, chicken bouillon and water. Microwave on high 3-5 minutes, stirring twice until mixture boils.

column9:
1 lb. ground pork sausage with sage
6 large eggs
1 tsp baking pwder
20 grape tomatoes, halves
2 1/2 cups (10 oz) shredded sharp cheddar cheese
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp freshly ground pepper
2 (9 inch) frozen unbaked pie shells, thawed
column10:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Cook sausage in large skillet over medium heat stirring until crumbly and no longer pink; drain well.
Whisk together eggs and baking powder; stir in sausage, tomatoes and next 3 ingredients. Divide mixture between pie shells.
Bake 25-30 minutes or until filling is set. Cool 10 minutes on wire racks before serving.

column9:
4 chicken breasts, split, boned and skinned
3/4 lb. swiss cheese, sliced
1 can (10 3/4 oz) condensed cream of celery soup
3/4 cup dry sherry or vermouth
1 cup herb-flavored croutons
column10: Arrange chicken in greased 2-quart baking dish. Put cheese slices over chicken. Mix soup with sherry; pour over cheese. Sprinkle with croutons; dot with butter. Bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until tender. Good served with steamed broccoli and a salad.
column11: I have used different cream soups and cheese, and substitute sherry for wine and even vodka.

column9:
2 1/2 lbs. cooking apples. peeled. cored, and thinly sliced (about 7 cups)
2/3 cup snipped dried cherries or dried cranberries
2/3 cup granulated sugar
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp ground cinnamon
1 17.3-oz pkg frozen puff pastry (2 sheets), thawed
Milk, for brushing
Coarse sugar, for sprinkling
1 cup powdered sugar
1/2 tsp vanilla
Dash salt
4-5 tsp milk
column10:
Preheat over to 375 degrees. Lightly grease a 15x10 inch baking pan. For filling, in a bowl stir together apples, dried cherries, granulated sugar, flour, and cinnamon.
On a lightly floured surface, unfold one sheet of pastry. Roll pastry into a 15x10 inch rectangle. Transfer to the prepared baking pan. Spread filling over pastry to within 1 inch of edges.
Unfold the remaining sheet of pastry; roll into a 16x11 inch rectangle. Place pastry on top of filling. Moisten edges of bottom pastry with milk. Fold bottom pastry over top pastry; gently press edges to seal. Using a sharp knife, cut slits in pastry. Brush lightly with milk and sprinkle with coarse sugar.
Bake 50-55 minutes or until filling is bubbly and pastry is puffed and golden. If needed to prevent overbrowning, cover pie loosely with foil the last 10-15 minutes of baking.
For icing, stir together powder sugar, vanilla, and salt. Stir in enough milk to reach drizzling consistency. Drizzle icing over warm pie. Cool on wire rack.

column9:
2 3/4 cups unsalted all-purpose flour
1 tsp baking powder
1 tsp ground cinnamon
3/4 tsp salt
1/2 tsp baking soda
1 3/4 cups granulated sugar
1/14 cups crisco oil
2 eggs
1/4 cup milk
1 tsp vanilla
2 cups chopped, peeled apple
1/2 cup nuts
1 tsp grated lemon peel
1-2 Tbsp confectioners sugar
column10:
Preheat over to 350 degrees. Grease and flour 12 cup fluted ring pan. Set aside.
Mix flour, baking powder, cinnamon, salt and baking soda in medium mixing bowl. Set aside. Combine granulated sugar, crisco oil, eggs, milk and vanilla in large mixing bowl. Beat with electric mixer at medium speed until blended, scraping bowl constantly. Add dry ingredients.
Beat at medium speed 2 minutes longer, scraping bowl frequently. Stir in apple, nuts and lemon peel. Pour into prepared pan.
Bake at 350 degrees, 1 hour to 1 hour 15 minutes, or until wooden pick inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 10 minutes. Invert onto serving plate. Cool slightly. Sift confectioners sugar onto cake. Serve warm. Top with whipped cream.

column9:
Salad
8 ounces uncooked vermicelli pasta
3/4 cup julienne-cut carrots, 2 inches long
3/4 cup julienne cut zucchini, 2 inches long
3/4 cup chopped red bell pepper
1/3 cup sliced green onions with tops
3/4 pound deli roast turkey or chicken breast, cut ½ inch thick

Dressing
1/4 cup vegetable oil
3 tablespoons rice vinegar
3 tablespoons reduced sodium soy sauce
2 teaspoons sugar
1/8 teaspoon ground red pepper
1 teaspoon finely chopped, peeled fresh ginger root
1 garlic clove, pressed
Coarsely chopped peanuts or cashews and fresh cilantro (optional)
column10:
For salad, break vermicelli into quarters.  Cook according to package directions in 4 QT casserole; drain and rinse under cold running water in colander.  Place vermicelli in large bowl and set aside.
Using Julienne peeler, cut carrots and zucchini into strips.  Chop bell pepper and slice green onions.  Cut turkey/chicken into thin piece, 2 inches long.  Add vegetables and turkey/chicken to vermicelli.
For dressing, combine oil, vinegar, soy sauce, sugar and ground red pepper in small batter bowl.  Peel gingerroot; finely chop using food chopper.  Add gingerroot and garlic pressed to batter bowl.  Mix well.  Pour dressing over salad; toss.  Cover and refrigerate at least 1 hour to allow flavors to blend. 
Spoon salad into serving bowl.  Garnish with chopped peanuts and cilantro, if desired.
column11:
Pre and cook time:  50 minutes, chill time: 1 hour

You can make this main-dish in the morning, then enjoy a relaxing glass or there of your favorite beverage in the afternoon knowing dinner is waiting in the fridge.

Crisp sesame breadsticks, melon wedges and orange sherbet are perfect accompaniments to this Asian-inspired salad.

column9:
11 oz. cream cheese
2 Tbsp Mayo
1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce
1 small minced onion (or onion powder)
1 dash garlic powder
column10:
Mix with beater.
Spread on plate – pour one bottle chile saue on top (or as much as you want).
On top of chile sauce spread 2 cans of Crab meat.
Can be chilled ahead of time as well.
Serve with crackers.
column11: Recipe from Grandma Radke's collection.
